Comment.MultiLanguageText: Is true if pinch setpoint is externally controlled

AttributeList.Text: Manual values are given as Pinch, regulator works on "Pinch Performance"
NOTE that we are not using the conventional bManual bit!! Due to the difference between "Pinch Performance" and "Pinch"

LineComment.Text: Enforce a lower bound on the superheat
- Preset manual value to current pinch value to set controller to this value if inactive. Except if bManualMode whwre we directely set it to the target pinch performance
- Limited to 1K superhetat to prevent division by zero and critical low pinch values
Preset with current pinch as starting value if "FORCE!_FixedPinch is used
- Current pinch performance for informative reasons
- Limited to 0.1K to prevent division by zero
The PinchPerfomance value is interpreted logarithmically as pinch set point (-oo => 0K; 0 => 1K; 110 => 163K).
Constant changes of PinchPerformance will cause only relative changes of the effective pinch. Pinch = e^(PinchPerformance/21,6)
Keep the manual value in sync to avoid discontinuities when switching from normal operation to Manual:

AttributeList.Text: Only Auto or Manual in this regulator
